channel.title: My View On Ethanol Factories
channel.description: While in school I made a Diagram of what would happen if the Goverment Decided to use Ethanol Factories. [IMG]http://img250.imageshack.us/img250/7928/ethanolfactorypc2.jpg[/img]

item.title: My View On Ethanol Factories
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

85 15 Is the main ratio I think. if it gets more miles per gallon, wouldn’t there have to be more enrgy? also, there is only ethanol when we have lots of corn… and other thigs that make it, and lots of fertilizers use oil.

Read full topic

item.title: My View On Ethanol Factories
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“bobby, post:24, topic:72270”]then why get it? more effective? how?

If the ethanol gives 34% less nergy, then I wouldn’t buy it unless it is 34% less $ than gas. why? because then the gas would be cheaper per mpg.[/quote]

Put it this way. You’re car, which is running off gasoline, has a MPG of 20 lets say. If it was running off ethanol then it would be 26.8 mpg.
Still, ethanol is still more expensive to use, so why use it? Well let’s see, first of all there is an unlimited supply. Secondly, it produces VERY little pollution so it would be much better for the environment. It’s reasons like gasoline that we have to deal with global warming.

If ethanol replaced gasoline entirely, then there would be a much higher production rate and the cost would drop a lot.

Also what you can do is mix part ethanol and part gasoline in a tank. I forget the ratio, but we’ve been talking about it in school(Biology).

Read full topic

item.title: My View On Ethanol Factories

then why get it? more effective? how?

item.title: My View On Ethanol Factories
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:72270”][quote author=afi link=topic=106186.msg1072709#msg1072709 date=1175408762]

What do you mean? It would drive the same.

No, You could tell that you would get Less MPG and when your brakes start to ware off easily
[/quote]

I doubt the less gas mileage claim, and I know for a fact it would have no effect at all on your brakes. Brakes have nothing to do with fuel.[/quote]

To support mopar,

ethanol contains approx. 34% less energy per gallon than gasoline, and therefore will result in a 34% reduction in miles per gallon.

And I was unable to find any information about it affecting your brakes.

Read full topic

[/quote]

No, You could tell that you would get Less MPG and when your brakes start to ware off easily[/quote]

item.title: My View On Ethanol Factories
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“bobby, post:16, topic:72270”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=106186.msg1072794#msg1072794 date=1175410080]
Imagine pumping ethanol at a gas station? One for me, one for you… one for me, one for you

Cars should run off hemp oil anyways
[/quote]

get bored and take some out right :P. Just to clarify, Ethanol is a kind of alchohol but it is poisonus to drink, but more poisonuns than regular alcholol.[/quote]

Err… no. No offense but I don’t think you know what you are talking about.

Ethanol IS what is used for alcoholic drinks. Beer, wine, liquor, etc. It’s what we drink. It is usually made by fermenting sugars and yeast.

Read full topic
